title.narrative: Mechanism 18406 - Positively United to Support Humanity (PUSH) FOA GH17-1721 (Follow-on to CoAg GH000153)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
In FY17 PEPFAR will continue to fund Davis Memorial Hospital (DMH) to support the Government of Guyana’s goal of providing universal access to HIV testing, care, treatment and support services. In consortium with St Joseph Mercy Hospital (SJMH) will build on past accomplishments in Guyana and addresses current challenges toward improved access to quality antiretroviral therapy (ART) clinical serv Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

In FY17 PEPFAR will continue to fund Davis Memorial Hospital (DMH) to support the Government of Guyana’s goal of providing universal access to HIV testing, care, treatment and support services. In consortium with St Joseph Mercy Hospital (SJMH) will build on past accomplishments in Guyana and addresses current challenges toward improved access to quality antiretroviral therapy (ART) clinical services at Faith Based Organizations (FBO) clinical sites. This IM will improve access to quality clinical services and contribute to an increase in coverage of antiretroviral therapy. The long-term goal is to build an integrated care and treatment approach locally which improves HIV delivery systems and expand coverage to KP - namely, the TG, CSW and MSM. It will also contribute to increased access to tailored and sensitive care and treatment services, improved linkages and re-engagement to care, retention on ART and ultimately viral suppression of all patients on treatment.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
